mn68:1.2: The Buddha is recorded as visiting this grove in two other discourses, which share a common narrative; both deal with the growth of spiritual qualities ([an10.67](), [an10.68]()).
mn68:2.1: This makes it sound like they had gone forth recently, which would date this discourse to the early years of the dispensation.
mn68:2.2: Pali editions vary a little in the exact monks mentioned.
mn68:4.2: Reading _te va_ as in PTS. Here the Buddha switches from addressing the monks as a whole to addressing just Anuruddha and his friends.
mn68:5.4: Also at [sn22.80:6.4]() and [iti91:2.4](). The terms here follow the same sequence as in the Vinaya account of ordination. Generally, ordination should not be given in such cases, but if it is given, those performing it incur an offense of wrong-doing. | Soldiers joined the Sangha to escape military service, so the Buddha said one should not ordain those in service to a king ([pli-tv-kd1:40.1.1]()). | Several rules regarding ordination of criminals were passed, the thrust of which is that wanted outlaws should not be ordained ([pli-tv-kd1:41.1.1]()). | Another man ordained to escape debt ([pli-tv-kd1:46.1.1]()). | “In fear” (_bhayaṭṭa_) is the only item that does not straightforwardly correspond to the Vinaya sequence, where instead the ordination of slaves appears at this point ([pli-tv-kd1:47.1.1]()). But a connection is suggested by the verses of the water-carrier Puṇṇikā, who speaks of living “in fear” of her masters’ abuse and beatings. | Seventeen boys ordained as novices to get a nice livelihood ([pli-tv-kd1:49.1.1]()).
mn68:6.2: This is the first absorption, lacking which their mind is full of hindrances.
mn68:7.3: Of the seven methods given at [mn2:4.1](), this omits “seeing”, “restraint”, and “developing”. The Buddha is asking whether his use of the four remaining methods make it look like he is secretly acting from defilements. Ifg his students are genuinely happy in the spiritual path, as attainers of jhana they will recognize the behavior of one whose mind is free of defilements.
mn68:8.3: At [sn44.9]() the six ascetic teachers are each said to do this, and the Buddha does it at [dn16:2.5.1]() = [dn18:1.4]().
